meta.name: Automate Time Tracking Enforcement & Cleanup for Awork Tasks

assignments.name: commentTimeNotTracked
assignments.value: Time not tracked! Status rolled back!

parameters.content:
## Enhanced time tracking features for awork

This workflow offers several additional features for time tracking with [https://www.awork.com](https://www.awork.com):

* Check whether time has been tracked when closing a task. If not, tasks are reopened and the user is notified. May be restricted to specific tasks by tags.
* Minimum time tracking for tasks to comply with "at least 15-minute intervals are billed" scenarios. May be restricted to specific tasks by tags.
* Time tracking cleanup to match billing intervals.
* Add a start time to time entries if it is missing.
* This workflow **does not use** the Awork community nodes package, as this package does not support all required API calls and is therefore not used here. If you would like to use that package, you can find more information at [https://support.awork.com/en/articles/9826591-n8n-integration](https://support.awork.com/en/articles/9826591-n8n-integration) and replace the HTTP nodes with matching community nodes if applicable.

### The following configuration settings are possible or required in the “Workflow config” node (following the webhook call):

* **finishedStateLabels** (Array, required): Label text of the task status entities that have the “Done” state. Must be stored as an array. Allows you to control whether the workflow is skipped for certain status changes, even if the task has been marked as completed.

* **forceTimeTracking** (Boolean, optional): Boolean setting indicating whether users are forced to track time on tasks before closing them.

* **limitForceTimeTrackingToTags** (Array, optional): Label text of the task tag entities. Must be stored as an array. Allows you to limit forced time tracking to specific tasks.

* **addComments** (Boolean, optional): Boolean setting indicating whether a comment is added to a task if a status change is undone by the workflow.

* **commentTimeNotTracked** (String, optional, required if addComments is true): Comment text added to a task when the status change is undone due to missing tracked time. Serves as a hint for the user.

* **setMinTimeTracking** (Float (minutes), optional): Defines a minimum time to be tracked for each task. For example, use "15" to track at least 15 minutes for any client request. If set to "0", minimum time tracking is disabled. Provide minutes as the parameter, e.g., "15" for a 15-minute minimum tracked time.

* **cleanupTimeTracking** (Boolean, optional): Boolean setting indicating whether to adjust time tracking to match a specific time interval (e.g., 15-minute intervals).

* **cleanupTimeTrackingInterval** (Float (minutes), optional): Time interval all time tracking entries should match. For example, a 12-minute tracked time for a task gets 3 more minutes added to reach the defined interval of 15 minutes.

* **cleanupTimeTrackingTolerance** (Float (minutes), optional): Tolerance for time tracking cleanup. For example, a tracked time of 16 minutes is not rounded to 30 if a tolerance of 2 minutes is set. If 0, even a second tracked beyond the set interval results in an additional interval being added.

* **billingTag** (Array, optional): Label text of task tags marking tasks as billable. Added time entries will be set as "billable" for those tasks.

* **forceStartTime** (Boolean, optional): Boolean setting indicating whether a start time is enforced for time tracking entries. If set to true, missing start times are added and a note is appended.

* **forceStartTimeText** (String, REQUIRED if forceStartTime is set): Note added to modified time tracking entries. Required to prevent endless loops.

* **systemWorkType** (String, REQUIRED): Add a work type in your Awork config and set the label text here so system-generated time entries may be added to tasks.

* **systemWorkText** (String, optional): Text added to system-generated time entries, e.g., "System generated time tracking".

* **timeZone** (String, REQUIRED): Define a time zone for system-generated time tracking, e.g., "Europe/Berlin". A full list can be found at [https://www.php.net/manual/en/timezones.php](https://www.php.net/manual/en/timezones.php) or other sources.

* **systemTimeUserId** (String, REQUIRED): UUID of the user assigned to system-generated time tracking. Either create a separate user or select an existing one. To retrieve the UUID of a user, go to the "User" list, click on a user to open the details page, and copy the ID from the URL (e.g., "ZZZZZZZZ-YYYY-XXXX-ZZZZ-YYYYYYYYYYYY/details"). Paste the "ZZZ...YYYY" part into the config node.

## How to use

**Awork configuration**

* Copy this workflow to your n8n installation  
* Add authentication credentials

* Add a new webhook call to Awork (see [https://support.awork.com/en/articles/5415462-webhooks](https://support.awork.com/en/articles/5415462-webhooks)) and configure as required (name, authentication, etc.)  
* Configure the webhook to be triggered on task status changes AND new time entries  
* Enable "Only events from first level properties" to reduce the number of webhook calls  
* Test and save the webhook  

* Generate a new API client (or use an existing one) (see [https://support.awork.com/en/articles/5415664-client-applications-and-api-keys](https://support.awork.com/en/articles/5415664-client-applications-and-api-keys))  

* Add new credentials for Awork to your n8n installation (see [https://docs.n8n.io/credentials/add-edit-credentials/](https://docs.n8n.io/credentials/add-edit-credentials/))  
++ Choose "Header auth" from the list and name it as you like, e.g., "Awork API Access"  
++ Set "name" to "Authorization" and "value" to "Bearer YOUR_TOKEN_HERE", with XXX replaced by the API key created in Awork  
++ Update all webhook calls in this workflow to use these credentials  

## Enjoy

### Workflow config
* Configure basic settings
### Extract status changes from webhook call payload

### Check if task status is currently "done"
* If yes, proceed
* If no, exit workflow

### Check if force time tracking is enabled and no time is tracked
* If yes, roll back task status
* If no, check if time tracking cleaning is enabled
## Green sticky notes: Logical group of nodes
## Red sticky notes: Routing and possible workflow exit

nodes.name: Check if force time tracking enabled

parameters.content:
### Check if force time tracking is limited to specific tags
* If yes, check task tags
* If no, roll back task status

nodes.name: Process tags and check if found in configured tags

parameters.content:
### Process task tags
* If a task tag is listed in "Limit forced time tracking to tags", return true
* If not found, return false

### Check if at least one task tag is listed in config node
* If yes, roll back task status
* If not, continue workflow

nodes.name: Check if tags listed in config node

parameters.content: ### Roll back task status

### Check if comment should be added to task
* Exit workflow if no comment should be added

### Add comment to task regarding roll back of task state
* Add comment and exit workflow

nodes.name: Roll back task status from done to previous state

parameters.content:
### Check if min time tracking OR time tracking cleanup is enabled
* If yes, check time tracked
* If no, exit workflow

### Check if tracked time is lesser than min time
* If yes, add new time tracking record to match min time in sum
* If no, continue workflow
### Roll back task status

### Check if comment should be added to task
* Exit workflow if no comment should be added

### Add comment to task regarding roll back of task state
* Add comment and exit workflow

nodes.name: Roll back task status from done to previous state1
Calculate time for added time tracking
Calculate time for added time tracking1
Roll back task status from done to previous state4

parameters.jsonBody:
={
  "isBillable": {{ $('Calculate time for added time tracking1').item.json.isBillable }},
  "isBilled": false,
  "taskId": "{{ $('Load task details for time tracking item').item.json.id }}",  
  "note": "{{ $('Workflow config').item.json.systemWorkText }}",  
  "timezone": "{{ $('Workflow config').item.json.timeZone }}",
  "duration": {{ $('Calculate time for added time tracking1').item.json.missingTrackedTime }},
  "breakDuration": null,  
  "startDateUtc": "{{ $now.setZone('Europe/Berlin').minus($('Calculate time for added time tracking1').item.json.missingTrackedTime,'seconds').startOf('day').toISO() }}",
  "startTimeUtc": "{{ $now.minus($('Calculate time for added time tracking1').item.json.missingTrackedTime,'seconds').format('HH:mm:ii') }}",
  "typeOfWorkId": "{{ $('Load system type of work').item.json.id }}",
  "userId": "{{ $('Workflow config').item.json.systemTimeUserId }}"  
}

parameters.content: ### Calculate missing tracked time and add system generated time tracking to task
### Update tracked time to match time tracking intervals

nodes.name: Load task details for time tracking item

parameters.content:
### Check if task should be time tracked by tag
* If yes, continue
* If no, exit workflow

### Check if added time tracking is not system generated to prevent endless loops
* If yes, check time tracked
* If no, exit workflow
### Load system type of work and related task data

nodes.name: Add tracked time to match min time settings

parameters.jsonBody:
={
  "isBillable": {{ $('Calculate time for added time tracking').item.json.isBillable }},
  "isBilled": false,
  "taskId": "{{ $('Load task details for time tracking item').item.json.id }}",  
  "note": "{{ $('Workflow config').item.json.systemWorkText }}",  
  "timezone": "{{ $('Workflow config').item.json.timeZone }}",
  "duration": {{ $('Calculate time for added time tracking').item.json.missingTrackedTime }},
  "breakDuration": null,  
  "startDateUtc": "{{ $now.setZone('Europe/Berlin').minus($('Calculate time for added time tracking').item.json.missingTrackedTime,'seconds').startOf('day').toISO() }}",
  "startTimeUtc": "{{ $now.minus($('Calculate time for added time tracking').item.json.missingTrackedTime,'seconds').format('HH:mm:ii') }}",
  "typeOfWorkId": "{{ $('Load system type of work').item.json.id }}",
  "userId": "{{ $('Workflow config').item.json.systemTimeUserId }}"
  
}

parameters.content:
### Check if forced start time is enabled
* If yes, update start time in tracked time
* If no, continue

nodes.name: Add start time to time tracking entry

parameters.jsonBody:
={  
  "note": "{{ $('Webhook call by Awork').item.json.body.entity.note }} ({{ $('Workflow config').item.json.forceStartTimeText }})",
  "timezone": "{{ $('Workflow config').item.json.timeZone }}",
  "startDateUtc": "{{ $now.setZone('Europe/Berlin').minus($('Webhook call by Awork').item.json.body.entity.duration,'seconds').startOf('day').toISO() }}",
  "startTimeUtc": "{{ $now.minus($('Webhook call by Awork').item.json.body.entity.duration,'seconds').format('HH:mm:ii') }}",
  "duration":  {{ $('Webhook call by Awork').item.json.body.entity.duration }},
  "typeOfWorkId": "{{ $('Webhook call by Awork').item.json.body.entity.typeOfWork.id }}",
  "userId": "{{ $('Webhook call by Awork').item.json.body.entity.user.id }}"  
}

parameters.content:
### Add start time to time tracking 
* Calculates start time based on duration in the past until now.
* Updates time tracking entry and appends note to time tracking text
